sentence: U.S. market indexes were lower on Wednesday.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 23,271.28 for a loss of -138.19 points or -0.59%.
The S&P 500 closed at 2,564.62 for a loss of -14.25 points or -0.55%.
The Nasdaq Composite closed at 6,706.21 for a loss of -31.66 points or -0.47%.
The VIX Volatility Index closed higher at 13.13 for a gain of 1.54 points or 13.29%.
U.S. market indexes continued losses on Wednesday.
Lower oil prices and uncertainty over pending tax reform were the main factors.
• The Mortgage Bankers Association's mortgage applications index increased 3.1% for the week.
• The Consumer Price Index increased 0.1% for the month and 2.0% for the year.
• Business inventories were unchanged from the previous month.
• The EIA petroleum status report showed an increase of 1.9 million barrels for the week.

In the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the following stocks led losses:

In the broad market, energy and consumer staples led losses.
Technology was also lower with the S&P 500 technology sector down -0.74%.
In small-caps, the Russell 2000 Index closed at 1,464.09 for a loss of -7.16 points or -0.49%.
The S&P 600 closed at 889.94 for a loss of -4.80 points or -0.54%.
The Dow Jones Small-Cap Growth TSM Index closed at 8,928.66 for a loss of -43.86 points or -0.49%.
The Dow Jones Small-Cap Value TSM Index closed at 9,833.09 for a loss of -45.18 points or -0.46%.

Other notable index closes included the S&P 400 Mid-Cap Index at 1,818.05 for a loss of -8.75 points or -0.48%; the S&P 100 Index at 1,130.74 for a loss of -6.00 points or -0.53%; the Russell 3000 Index at 1,517.09 for a loss of -8.17 points or -0.54%; the Russell 1000 Index at 1,420.93 for a loss of -7.71 points or -0.54%; and the Dow Jones U.S.
Select Dividend Index at 677.16 for a loss of -5.63 points or -0.82%.
